resource.name: postBox
resource.description: A numbered box located in a post station.

element.formal: A numbered box located in a post station.

resource.name: Mother's Maiden name
resource.description: Mother's maiden name - commonly collected to help verify patient identity.

element.formal: Mother's maiden name - commonly collected to help verify patient identity.

mapping.map: Role relationship to entity with maiden name (?)

resource.name: CDA Birthplace
resource.description: Standard Profile for CDA R2 on FHIR

resource.name: Body site of manifestations
resource.publisher: Health Level Seven, Inc / openEHR project
resource.description: The anatomical location / body site(s) where the symptoms manifested.

element.formal: The anatomical location / body site(s) where the symptoms manifested.

binding.name: BodySite
binding.description: Codes describing anatomical locations. May include laterality

resource.name: Associated goal
resource.publisher: Health Level Seven, Inc. - FHIR WG
resource.description: The goal associated with the request.

element.formal: The goal associated with the request.

resource.name: Functionality not allowed
resource.publisher: Health Level Seven, Inc. - [WG Name] WG
resource.description: If set to true, indicates that support for the specified behavior would make a system non=conformant with the specification.

element.formal: If set to true, indicates that support for the specified behavior would make a system non=conformant with the specification.

resource.name: Extra text to display for group
resource.publisher: U.S. Office of the National Coordinator (ONC)'s Standards and Infrastructure (S&I) Structured Data Capture project
resource.description: Additional text to display at the group level along with guidance as to what sort of text it is.

element.short: Extra text to display for group
element.formal: Additional text to display at the group level along with guidance as to what sort of text it is.
The additional text to display.
Categorizes the type of additional group text.  E.g. "Tool tip", "Help", "Trailing text", etc.
element.comments: The type of text may provide guidance for how/when to display the information.

binding.name: QuestionnaireGroupTextType
binding.description: Categorizes the type of additional group text.  E.g. "Tool tip", "Help", "Trailing text", etc.

resource.name: Source of a validation message
resource.publisher: Health Level Seven, Inc. - [WG Name] WG
resource.description: Helps a user track down the source of the problem.

element.formal: Helps a user track down the source of the problem.

resource.name: Kind of observation
resource.publisher: HL7 International - Orders and Observations WG
resource.description: This extension is used to classify the kind of observation in Observation.value for laboratory reporting and to differentiate between actual test results, responses to filler questions when ordering tests and other unsolicted responses.  This may be required to drive operational functionality.

element.formal: This extension is used to classify the kind of observation in Observation.value for laboratory reporting and to differentiate between actual test results, responses to filler questions when ordering tests and other unsolicted responses.  This may be required to drive operational functionality.

binding.name: USLabObservationKind
binding.description: Code to classify the kind of observation in Observation.value[x]

resource.name: Implemented CDE
resource.description: A reference to the Data Element that corresponds to the question text and answer constraints for this question.

element.formal: A reference to the Data Element that corresponds to the question text and answer constraints for this question.
element.comments: If a code applies to a question, that code should still be conveyed on the question, even if the same code is also referenced as a DataElement.code in the referenced data element.  This extension must not be used in place of specifying the Questionnaire.group.question.concept element.

resource.name: Additional datetime results
resource.publisher: HL7 International - Orders and Observations WG
resource.description: This extension is used when there are multiple result values for a single Observation Resource.  The first result for this observation is the value[x] element and any additional dateTime results for this observation will go here.

element.formal: This extension is used when there are multiple result values for a single Observation Resource.  The first result for this observation is the value[x] element and any additional dateTime results for this observation will go here.
element.comments: Having a single value for each Observation Resource is preferred.

resource.name: BAD | CONF | HP | HV | DIR | PUB | PHYS | PST
resource.description: Uses of Addresses - codes not defined as part of Address.use.

element.short: BAD | CONF | HP | HV | DIR | PUB | PHYS | PST
element.formal: Uses of Addresses - codes not defined as part of Address.use.

binding.name: PostalAddressUse
binding.description: Uses of an address not included in Address.use

resource.name: User or Org actually involved in creating the value set content
resource.description: User or Org actually involved in creating the value set content.

element.short: User or Org actually involved in creating the value set content
element.formal: User or Org actually involved in creating the value set content.

resource.name: User prompt for format
resource.description: A syntax intended for display to the user to guide their input (i.e. a human readable version of a regular expression).  For example "nnn-nnn-nnn".

element.formal: A syntax intended for display to the user to guide their input (i.e. a human readable version of a regular expression).  For example "nnn-nnn-nnn".

resource.name: CDA Organization Relationship Status
resource.description: Standard Profile for CDA R2 on FHIR

element.short: The status of the organizational relationship

resource.name: Mother(s) & Father(s) - genetic & other
resource.description: Identifies a parent of the relative.

element.formal: Identifies a parent of the relative.
element.comments: Some individuals may have more than two parents (e.g. genetic vs. adoptive parents).  Even non-genetic relationships can be relevant in terms of genetic exposure.

element.formal: Distinguishes between different types of parental relationships with varying granularity to support capturing the relationship "to the degree known".

binding.name: ParentRelationshipType
binding.description: Parental relationship types

element.formal: Points to the 'id' attribute on the relation who is the parent of this relation.

resource.name: streetNameType
resource.description: The designation given to the street. (e.g. Street, Avenue, Crescent, etc.).

element.formal: The designation given to the street. (e.g. Street, Avenue, Crescent, etc.).

resource.name: Reference to a trusted expansion
resource.description: Indicates an authoritative source for performing value set expansions.

element.formal: Indicates an authoritative source for performing value set expansions.

resource.name: The status of a Concern associated with a condition
resource.display: This is the status of the Concern related to the Condition
resource.description: This communicates the status of the Concern associated with a condition. Values can be Active/Inactive/Resolved.

element.short: The status of a Concern associated with a condition
element.formal: This communicates the status of the Concern associated with a condition. Values can be Active/Inactive/Resolved.

resource.name: registered | preliminary | final
resource.publisher: HL7 International - Orders and Observations WG
resource.description: The status of the list.

element.formal: The status of the list.

binding.name: ListStatusCodes
binding.description: Codes providing the status of a list

resource.name: Observation Negation Indicator
resource.publisher: HL7 International - Orders and Observations WG
resource.description: This  modifier extension is used indicate negation of the entire observation.  ie the observation result "A"  is negated to "not A".

element.formal: This  modifier extension is used indicate negation of the entire observation.  ie the observation result "A"  is negated to "not A".

resource.name: Clinical Management Description
resource.publisher: Health Level Seven, Inc / openEHR project
resource.description: Text description about the clinical management provided.

element.formal: Text description about the clinical management provided.

resource.name: Reference to the DeviceMetric resource
resource.display: Reference to the external Device Metric resource
resource.publisher: Health Level Seven, Inc. - Health Care Devices (DEV) WG
resource.description: This extension provides the facility to link the current Observation resource to the DeviceMetric resource from where the data is coming from.

element.formal: This extension provides the facility to link the current Observation resource to the DeviceMetric resource from where the data is coming from.

resource.name: Template Status Code (more authoring statuses)
resource.publisher: Health Level Seven, Inc. - [WG Name] WG
resource.description: Status code taken from [HL7 template specification](http://wiki.hl7.org/images/7/7a/TemplatesDSTU-20140910b-96.pdf.zip) - allows for alignment with the template DSTU, and has more authoring status codes.

element.formal: Status code taken from [HL7 template specification](http://wiki.hl7.org/images/7/7a/TemplatesDSTU-20140910b-96.pdf.zip) - allows for alignment with the template DSTU, and has more authoring status codes.
element.comments: The Profile status has the codes that are relevant to end-users/developers, while this extension has the codes used by profile developers.

binding.name: TemplateStatusCode
binding.description: The status indicates the level of maturity of the design and may be used to manage the use of the design

resource.name: Minimum repetitions
resource.description: The minimum number of times the group must appear or the minimum number of answers for a question - when greater than 1.

element.formal: The minimum number of times the group must appear or the minimum number of answers for a question - when greater than 1.
element.comments: Default assumption for "required" elements is minOccurs=1.

mapping.map: N/A - MIF rather than RIM level

resource.name: Most recent change
resource.description: Provides the provenance record associated with the most recent update of the resource.

element.formal: Provides the provenance record associated with the most recent update of the resource.

resource.name: Maximum digits after decimal
resource.description: Identifies the maximum number of decimal places that may be specified for the data element.

element.formal: Identifies the maximum number of decimal places that may be specified for the data element.

resource.name: streetName
resource.description: streetName.

element.formal: streetName.

resource.name: Comparison value for ordinal codes
resource.description: A numeric value that allows the comparison (less than, greater than) or other numerical manipulation of a concept (e.g. Adding up components of a score).

element.formal: A numeric value that allows the comparison (less than, greater than) or other numerical manipulation of a concept (e.g. Adding up components of a score).

resource.name: A category of human sharing heritage
resource.description: A code classifying the person into a named category of humans sharing a common real or presumed heritage.

element.short: A category of human sharing heritage
element.formal: A code classifying the person into a named category of humans sharing a common real or presumed heritage.

binding.name: Ethnicity
binding.description: A code classifying the person into a named category of humans sharing a common real or presumed heritage.

resource.name: delimiter
resource.description: Delimiters are printed without framing white space. If no value component is provided, the delimiter appears as a line break.

element.formal: Delimiters are printed without framing white space. If no value component is provided, the delimiter appears as a line break.
element.comments: This really has no rationale use in FHIR.

resource.name: code for string
resource.description: Provides a coded expression for the content represented in a string.

element.formal: Provides a coded expression for the content represented in a string.

binding.name: StringCoding
binding.description: A coded representation for a string.  Could be codes for country in a country address part, codes for prefixes in a name part, etc.

resource.name: deliveryInstallationQualifier
resource.description: A number, letter or name identifying a delivery installation. E.g., for Station A, the delivery installation qualifier would be 'A'.

element.formal: A number, letter or name identifying a delivery installation. E.g., for Station A, the delivery installation qualifier would be 'A'.

resource.name: Additional coded results
resource.publisher: HL7 International - Orders and Observations WG
resource.description: This extension is used when there are multiple result values for a single Observation Resource.  The first result for this observation is the value[x] element and any additional coded results for this observation will go here.

element.formal: This extension is used when there are multiple result values for a single Observation Resource.  The first result for this observation is the value[x] element and any additional coded results for this observation will go here.
element.comments: Having a single value for each Observation Resource is preferred.

resource.name: Treat default as fixed value?
resource.description: If true, the default value is set as a fixed "answer" for the question.

element.formal: If true, the default value is set as a fixed "answer" for the question.

mapping.map: N/A - MIF rather than RIM level

resource.name: Code system name
resource.description: The human-readable name for the code system.

element.formal: The human-readable name for the code system.

resource.name: Probability Distribution Type for uncertainty
resource.description: A code specifying the type of probability distribution for the uncertainty.

element.formal: A code specifying the type of probability distribution for the uncertainty.
element.comments: This is only meaningful if there is also an uncertainty extension. If there is and uncertainty extension with no type, this means  that the probability distribution type is unknown. In that case, the uncertainty has the meaning of an informal guess.

binding.name: ProbabilityDistributionType
binding.description: Codes specifying the type of probability distribution

resource.name: deliveryMode
resource.description: Indicates the type of service offered, method of delivery. For example: post office box, rural route, general delivery, etc.

element.formal: Indicates the type of service offered, method of delivery. For example: post office box, rural route, general delivery, etc.

resource.name: streetAddressLine
resource.description: Description: A street address line is frequently used instead of breaking out build number, street name, street type, etc. An address generally has only a delivery address line or a street address line, but not both.

element.formal: Description: A street address line is frequently used instead of breaking out build number, street name, street type, etc. An address generally has only a delivery address line or a street address line, but not both.

resource.name: direction
resource.description: Direction (e.g., N, S, W, E).

element.formal: Direction (e.g., N, S, W, E).

resource.name: Place of Birth for patient
resource.description: The registered place of birth of the patient.

element.formal: The registered place of birth of the patient.

resource.name: Are styles important for processing?
resource.description: Indicates that the style extensions in this resource are essential to the interpretation of the styled text and that it cannot be rendered without the style without losing essential information.

element.formal: Indicates that the style extensions in this resource are essential to the interpretation of the styled text and that it cannot be rendered without the style without losing essential information.
element.comments: If set to true, all systems that claim to support this extension and which render elements of the resource containing this extension SHALL either render the content as required by the style extensions defined by this profile that are present in the resource or shall (if safe to do so based on their own rules), omit entirely the styled content they cannot render in accordance with the extensions.

resource.name: CDA Organizational Parent
resource.description: Standard Profile for CDA R2 on FHIR

element.short: The type of the organizational relationship

resource.name: Observations that confirm or refute
resource.publisher: Health Level Seven, Inc / openEHR project
resource.description: Observations that confirm or refute the risk and/or the substance.

element.formal: Observations that confirm or refute the risk and/or the substance.

resource.name: No more than this many characters
resource.description: The maximum number of characters that must be present in the simple data type to be considered a "valid" instance.

element.short: No more than this many characters
element.formal: The maximum number of characters that must be present in the simple data type to be considered a "valid" instance.
element.comments: For base64binary, reflects the number of characters representing the encoded data, not the number of bytes of the binary data.

resource.name: Alternative names
resource.description: Human readable names for the valueset.

element.formal: Human readable names for the valueset.
This name is intended to be human readable, short and as specific as possible and to convey the purpose of the value set.  It is considered to be the name of the value set.
element.comments: This need not be unique. However some use cases require uniqueness within a namespace and therefore best practice would be to make the name unique.

element.short: Which name is preferred for this language
element.formal: Flag that this Name in this Name Language is the preferred human-readable signifier in this language.
element.comments: There may be multiple human readable names in a given language, and this flag indicates which of them is preferred for the given language.

resource.name: Don't display to user
resource.description: If true, indicates that the containing group or question should not be displayed to the user for data entry.

element.formal: If true, indicates that the containing group or question should not be displayed to the user for data entry.
element.comments: Some questionnaires may have questions that represent calculated values or internal "fixed" metadata.  These elements need to be included with the answers, but should not be displayed to the user.

resource.name: Must be >= this value
resource.description: The inclusive lower bound on the range of allowed values for the data element.

element.formal: The inclusive lower bound on the range of allowed values for the data element.
element.comments: Data type specified must be the same as the data type for the data element.

resource.name: Type of attachment
resource.description: Identifies the kind(s) of [[[Attachment]]] allowed to be sent in answer to the question.

element.formal: Identifies the kind(s) of [[[Attachment]]] allowed to be sent in answer to the question.
element.comments: This extension only has meaning if the question.type = Attachment.

binding.name: MimeType
binding.description: The mime type of an attachment

resource.name: Genetic markers, ethnicity, etc.
resource.description: Allows capturing risk-relevant observations about the relative that aren't themselves a specific health condition.  E.g. Certain ethnic ancestries that are disease-relevant, presence of particular genetic markers, etc.

element.formal: Allows capturing risk-relevant observations about the relative that aren't themselves a specific health condition.  E.g. Certain ethnic ancestries that are disease-relevant, presence of particular genetic markers, etc.
element.comments: This may be extended with additional genomics-specific resources when they are ready.

resource.name: Must be <= this value
resource.description: The inclusive upper bound on the range of allowed values for the data element.

element.formal: The inclusive upper bound on the range of allowed values for the data element.
element.comments: Data type specified must be the same as the data type for the data element.

resource.name: additionalLocator
resource.description: This can be a unit designator, such as apartment number, suite number, or floor. There may be several unit designators in an address (e.g., "3rd floor, Appt. 342"). This can also be a designator pointing away from the location, rather than specifying a smaller location within some larger one (e.g., Dutch "t.o." means "opposite to" for house boats located across the street facing houses).

element.formal: This can be a unit designator, such as apartment number, suite number, or floor. There may be several unit designators in an address (e.g., "3rd floor, Appt. 342"). This can also be a designator pointing away from the location, rather than specifying a smaller location within some larger one (e.g., Dutch "t.o." means "opposite to" for house boats located across the street facing houses).

resource.name: censusTract
resource.description: A geographic sub-unit delineated for demographic purposes.

element.formal: A geographic sub-unit delineated for demographic purposes.

resource.name: deliveryAddressLine
resource.description: A delivery address line is frequently used instead of breaking out delivery mode, delivery installation, etc. An address generally has only a delivery address line or a street address line, but not both.

element.formal: A delivery address line is frequently used instead of breaking out delivery mode, delivery installation, etc. An address generally has only a delivery address line or a street address line, but not both.

resource.name: Goal category
resource.publisher: Health Level Seven, Inc. - FHIR WG
resource.description: The class of goal.

element.formal: The class of goal.

resource.name: Text description about exposure to the Substance
resource.publisher: Health Level Seven, Inc / openEHR project
resource.description: Text description about exposure to the Substance.

element.short: Text description about exposure to the Substance
element.formal: Text description about exposure to the Substance.

resource.name: unitType
resource.description: Indicates the type of specific unit contained within a building or complex. E.g. Appartment, Floor.

element.formal: Indicates the type of specific unit contained within a building or complex. E.g. Appartment, Floor.

resource.name: Hinting information for the narrative generator
resource.publisher: Health Level Seven, Inc. - [WG Name] WG
resource.description: Hinting information for the narrative generator - a series of name: value; pairs.

element.short: Hinting information for the narrative generator
element.formal: Hinting information for the narrative generator - a series of name: value; pairs.
element.comments: known names: default (default value - don't represent if this value).

resource.name: Actual medication record, if known
resource.publisher: Health Level Seven, Inc / openEHR project
resource.description: Link to an actual medication administration record with the full details of the administration, if a link is known.

element.formal: Link to an actual medication administration record with the full details of the administration, if a link is known.

resource.name: unitID
resource.description: The number or name of a specific unit contained within a building or complex, as assigned by that building or complex.

element.formal: The number or name of a specific unit contained within a building or complex, as assigned by that building or complex.

resource.name: When data element is "valid"
resource.description: Identifies the date on which the element became (or is expected to become) active and the date on which the element became (or is expected to become) retired.

element.formal: Identifies the date on which the element became (or is expected to become) active and the date on which the element became (or is expected to become) retired.

resource.name: Whether the concept has been deprecated
resource.description: Set to true of the concept has been deprecated (still can be used, but soon to be withdrawn).

element.short: Whether the concept has been deprecated
element.formal: Set to true of the concept has been deprecated (still can be used, but soon to be withdrawn).

resource.name: Display value for the code
resource.description: The display name for the code.  I.e. ValueSet.define.concept.display (or its equivalent).

element.formal: The display name for the code.  I.e. ValueSet.define.concept.display (or its equivalent).

resource.name: Object Class
resource.description: A concept that represents a set of ideas, abstractions, or things in the real world that can be identified with explicit boundaries and meaning and whose properties and behavior follow the same rules. It may be either a single or a group of associated concepts, abstractions, or things.

element.formal: A concept that represents a set of ideas, abstractions, or things in the real world that can be identified with explicit boundaries and meaning and whose properties and behavior follow the same rules. It may be either a single or a group of associated concepts, abstractions, or things.
element.comments: ObjectClass and Property are treated as a data model that can be mapped to like any other.  This extension merely captures the ObjectClass element as a discrete code.  The information conveyed here should also be conveyed in human-readable form in the mapping.map element.

binding.name: 11179ObjectClass
binding.description: A concept that represents a set of ideas, abstractions, or things in the real world that can be identified with explicit boundaries and meaning and whose properties and behavior follow the same rules.  E.g. Person, Prescription, Encounter, etc.

resource.name: Additional Interpretation Codes
resource.publisher: HL7 International - Orders and Observations WG
resource.description: This extension is used when there are multiple interpretation values for a single Observation Resource.  The first interpretation for this observation is the interpretation element and any additional interpretations for this observation will go here.

element.formal: This extension is used when there are multiple interpretation values for a single Observation Resource.  The first interpretation for this observation is the interpretation element and any additional interpretations for this observation will go here.

binding.name: ObservationInterpretation
binding.description: Codes identifying interpretations of observations

resource.name: At least this many characters
resource.description: The minimum number of characters that must be present in the simple data type to be considered a "valid" instance.

element.formal: The minimum number of characters that must be present in the simple data type to be considered a "valid" instance.
element.comments: For base64binary, reflects the number of characters representing the encoded data, not the number of bytes of the binary data.

resource.name: deliveryInstallationType
resource.description: Indicates the type of delivery installation (the facility to which the mail will be delivered prior to final shipping via the delivery mode.) Example: post office, letter carrier depot, community mail center, station, etc.

element.formal: Indicates the type of delivery installation (the facility to which the mail will be delivered prior to final shipping via the delivery mode.) Example: post office, letter carrier depot, community mail center, station, etc.

resource.name: Copy to practitioner
resource.publisher: HL7 International - Orders and Observations WG
resource.description: Non-ordering practitioner, to whom the orderer instructs the recipient to send the results of the request.

element.formal: Non-ordering practitioner, to whom the orderer instructs the recipient to send the results of the request.
element.comments: create type for each resource.

resource.name: Human-specified notes and other documentation
resource.description: Each comment is a time-stamped entry of arbitrary length that is not editable except by anyone in the author group.

element.formal: Each comment is a time-stamped entry of arbitrary length that is not editable except by anyone in the author group.
Comments created about the value set.
Time the comment was recorded.

resource.name: header | footer
resource.publisher: U.S. Office of the National Coordinator (ONC)'s Standards and Infrastructure (S&I) Structured Data Capture project
resource.description: If specified, indicates that the group should be rendered as a repeating header or footer on each "page" of the questionnaire.

element.formal: If specified, indicates that the group should be rendered as a repeating header or footer on each "page" of the questionnaire.
element.comments: When omitted, sections are presumed to be "regular" sections.

binding.name: QuestionnaireGroupSpecialType
binding.description: If specified, indicates that the group should be rendered as a repeating header or footer on each "page" of the questionnaire.

resource.name: houseNumber
resource.description: The number of a building, house or lot alongside the street. Also known as "primary street number". This does not number the street but rather the building.

element.formal: The number of a building, house or lot alongside the street. Also known as "primary street number". This does not number the street but rather the building.

resource.name: Amount of time individual was exposed to Substance
resource.publisher: Health Level Seven, Inc / openEHR project
resource.description: The amount of time the individual was exposed to the Substance.

element.short: Amount of time individual was exposed to Substance
element.formal: The amount of time the individual was exposed to the Substance.

resource.name: If code is case sensitive
resource.description: If this a case sensitive code.

element.formal: If this a case sensitive code.
element.comments: See comments on ValueSet.define.caseSensitive. Systems should generally assume case sensitivity when dealing with expansions, and only consider case sensitivity when matching existing codes.

resource.name: Where to send answers
resource.publisher: U.S. Office of the National Coordinator (ONC)'s Standards and Infrastructure (S&I) Structured Data Capture project
resource.description: The base URL for the server to which questionnaire answers associated with this questionnaire should be submitted.

element.formal: The base URL for the server to which questionnaire answers associated with this questionnaire should be submitted.
element.comments: Indicates that the form has been designed with an expectation that it will be submitted to the specified URI.  If multiple endpoints are specified, expectation is that answers are submitted to all endpoints.

resource.name: What kind of questionnaire?
resource.description: A code that identifies the questionnaire as falling into a particular group of like questionnaires.  E.g. "Pediatric", "Admissions", "Research", "Demographic", "Opinion Survey", etc.

element.formal: A code that identifies the questionnaire as falling into a particular group of like questionnaires.  E.g. "Pediatric", "Admissions", "Research", "Demographic", "Opinion Survey", etc.

binding.name: QuestionnaireCategory
binding.description: Classifications for questionnaires.  Can include such concepts as "intake form", "opinion survey", "clinical research questionnaire", "pediatric", etc.

resource.name: Date(/time) of first exposure to Substance
resource.publisher: Health Level Seven, Inc / openEHR project
resource.description: Record of the date and/or time of the first exposure to the Substance for this Reaction Event.

element.short: Date(/time) of first exposure to Substance
element.formal: Record of the date and/or time of the first exposure to the Substance for this Reaction Event.
element.comments: Exposure can be more complicated by more than one exposure events leading to a reaction. Further details about the nature of the exposure can be provided in additional extensions, or as text in the Exposure Description extension.

resource.name: External Identifier associated with this element
resource.description: External Identifiers associated with this element - these are identifiers that are associated with the concept this element represents.

element.short: External Identifier associated with this element
element.formal: External Identifiers associated with this element - these are identifiers that are associated with the concept this element represents.

resource.name: Based On Measure
resource.publisher: Health Level Seven, Inc. - Clinical Quality Information WG
resource.description: Based On Measure.

element.formal: Based On Measure.

resource.name: Clinical Management Details
resource.publisher: Health Level Seven, Inc / openEHR project
resource.description: Additional details about the clinical management provided for this Reaction Event.

element.formal: Additional details about the clinical management provided for this Reaction Event.

resource.name: CDA Language Preference
resource.description: Standard Profile for CDA R2 on FHIR

resource.name: precinct
resource.description: A subsection of a municipality.

element.formal: A subsection of a municipality.

resource.name: CDA Language Proficiency
resource.description: Standard Profile for CDA R2 on FHIR

resource.name: Only allow data when:
resource.description: If present, indicates that the group or question containing the extension should only be enabled (allow an answer to be present and, in most circumstances, even be visible to the user) when the specified condition is true.

element.formal: If present, indicates that the group or question containing the extension should only be enabled (allow an answer to be present and, in most circumstances, even be visible to the user) when the specified condition is true.
element.comments: Allows questionnaires to adapt based on answers to prior questions.  E.g. If physical gender is specified as a male, no need to capture pregnancy history.

element.formal: The linkId for the question whose answer must be present in order for the "enable" to be triggered.
If present, then the specified question must match the specified answer for all components present in the enableWhen.answer.

resource.name: CDA Organization Relationship Effective time
resource.description: Standard Profile for CDA R2 on FHIR

element.short: The period of the organizational relationship

resource.name: target if different from the subject.
resource.description: This extension is used when you want to identify the target whose characteristics (direct or indirect) are described by the observation if different from the Observation.subject.  For example,  the .indirectTarget may be a fetus, or a donor.

element.short: target if different from the subject.
element.formal: This extension is used when you want to identify the target whose characteristics (direct or indirect) are described by the observation if different from the Observation.subject.  For example,  the .indirectTarget may be a fetus, or a donor.

resource.name: CCDA related observation types
resource.publisher: HL7 International - Orders and Observations WG
resource.description: CCDA related observation types.

element.formal: CCDA related observation types.

resource.name: XDSDocumentEntry.practiceSettingCode
resource.description: The code specifying the clinical specialty where the act that resulted in the document was performed (e.g., Family Practice, Laboratory, Radiology).

element.formal: The code specifying the clinical specialty where the act that resulted in the document was performed (e.g., Family Practice, Laboratory, Radiology).

resource.name: Allowed resource for reference
resource.description: Where the type for a question is "Reference", indicates a type of resource that is permitted.

element.formal: Where the type for a question is "Reference", indicates a type of resource that is permitted.
element.comments: This extension only has meaning if the question.type = Reference.  If no allowedResource extensions are present, the presumption is that any type of resource is permitted.  If multiple are present, then any of the specified types are permitted.

binding.name: ResourceType
binding.description: One of the resource types defined as part of FHIR

resource.name: String equivalent with html markup
resource.description: This is an equivalent of the string on which the extension is sent, but includes additional XHTML markup, such as bold, italics, styles, tables, etc.

element.formal: This is an equivalent of the string on which the extension is sent, but includes additional XHTML markup, such as bold, italics, styles, tables, etc.

resource.name: Additional time results
resource.publisher: HL7 International - Orders and Observations WG
resource.description: This extension is used when there are multiple result values for a single Observation Resource.  The first result for this observation is the value[x] element and any additional time results for this observation will go here.

element.formal: This extension is used when there are multiple result values for a single Observation Resource.  The first result for this observation is the value[x] element and any additional time results for this observation will go here.
element.comments: Having a single value for each Observation Resource is preferred.

resource.name: Additional ratio results
resource.publisher: HL7 International - Orders and Observations WG
resource.description: This extension is used when there are multiple result values for a single Observation Resource.  The first result for this observation is the value[x] element and any additional ratio (e.g. classic titers) results for this observation will go here.

element.formal: This extension is used when there are multiple result values for a single Observation Resource.  The first result for this observation is the value[x] element and any additional ratio (e.g. classic titers) results for this observation will go here.
element.comments: Having a single value for each Observation Resource is preferred.

resource.name: Who has used and how?
resource.description: Consumers of the value set and the implementations, projects or standards that the author has utilized the value set in.

element.formal: Consumers of the value set and the implementations, projects or standards that the author has utilized the value set in.
element.comments: This is likely to be a ???point in time??? view and should not be considered an authoritative listing of all uses of the value set.

element.short: A consumer of or client for the value set
element.formal: This is most likely to be an organization but can be an individual. It would not be a program, that information should be recorded in the usage.use.
A descriptive name of the project or standard in which the value set is used.

resource.name: E.g. "1(a)", "2.5.3"
resource.description: A label for a particular group or question within the questionnaire.

element.formal: A label for a particular group or question within the questionnaire.
element.comments: These are generally unique within a questionnaire, though this is not guaranteed. Some questionnaires may have multiple questions with the same label with logic to control which gets exposed.

resource.name: CDA Language Mode
resource.description: Standard Profile for CDA R2 on FHIR

resource.name: language
resource.description: The language in which the string is expressed.

element.formal: The language in which the string is expressed.

binding.name: Language
binding.description: A human language

resource.name: Standard Deviation (same units as the quantity)
resource.description: The primary measure of variance/uncertainty of the value (the square root of the sum of the squares of the differences between all data points and the mean).

element.short: Standard Deviation (same units as the quantity)
element.formal: The primary measure of variance/uncertainty of the value (the square root of the sum of the squares of the differences between all data points and the mean).
element.comments: standardDeviation has the same units as the quantity. It is used to normalize the data for computing the distribution function. Applications that cannot deal with probability distributions can still get an idea about the confidence level by looking at standardDeviation.

resource.name: CDA Organization Relationship Type
resource.description: Standard Profile for CDA R2 on FHIR

element.short: The type of the organizational relationship

resource.name: Kind of value set
resource.description: Identifies the value set as belonging to a particular set.  For example "demographics", "lab", "clinical research", etc.  Might also be used to tie a value set to particular usage projects.

element.formal: Identifies the value set as belonging to a particular set.  For example "demographics", "lab", "clinical research", etc.  Might also be used to tie a value set to particular usage projects.
element.comments: The categories chosen will vary widely depending on the purpose of the value set repository.

binding.name: ValueSetCategory
binding.description: Classifications for valuesets.  Can include such concepts as "demographics", "lab", "clinical research".  Might also be used to tie a value set to particular usage projects

resource.name: Maximum repetitions
resource.description: The maximum number of times the group must appear or the minimum number of answers for a question - when greater than 1 and not unlimited.

element.formal: The maximum number of times the group must appear or the minimum number of answers for a question - when greater than 1 and not unlimited.
element.comments: Only relevant if the element has repeats=true and there's a need to constrain the number of allowed repetitions.

mapping.map: N/A - MIF rather than RIM level

resource.name: Additional identifier
resource.publisher: HL7 International - Orders and Observations WG
resource.description: This extension is used when there are multiple observation identifiers for a single observation .  The Observation.identifier is the first identifier for this observation and any additional identifiers will go here.

element.formal: This extension is used when there are multiple observation identifiers for a single observation .  The Observation.identifier is the first identifier for this observation and any additional identifiers will go here.

resource.name: Indicates the state of development of the value set
resource.description: Workflow Status is used to represent details of the value set development process while the value set has an Activity Status of Preliminary. The development of a value set often follows a formal workflow process from initiation to completion, and this element carries the state variable for this state machine. The assumption is that when first created a value set would have a workflow state of Draft. Additional workflow states may be used.

element.short: Indicates the state of development of the value set
element.formal: Workflow Status is used to represent details of the value set development process while the value set has an Activity Status of Preliminary. The development of a value set often follows a formal workflow process from initiation to completion, and this element carries the state variable for this state machine. The assumption is that when first created a value set would have a workflow state of Draft. Additional workflow states may be used.
element.comments: The values that this element may assume include phrases that capture various stages in review and approval. In addition to the minimum of ???Draft???,  these include ???Proposed???, ???Approved???, ???Ready to Publish???.  There may be additional states defined by different developers. This is an optional element because the use of Activity Status ???Preliminary??? may be sufficient for some implementations.

resource.name: CDA Guardian Identifier
resource.description: Standard Profile for CDA R2 on FHIR

resource.name: NI | OTH | NINF | PINF | UNK | ASKU | NAV | NASK | TRC | MSK | NA | QS
resource.description: If the value is not a proper value, indicates the reason.

element.short: NI | OTH | NINF | PINF | UNK | ASKU | NAV | NASK | TRC | MSK | NA | QS
element.formal: If the value is not a proper value, indicates the reason.
element.comments: Considerable care must be used when using nullFlavor in this context of FHIR - more than any other concept, this is tied to the way v3 works, and FHIR is quite different. For instance, there is no notion of a "proper value" as opposed to any other value in FHIR. a NullFlavor should be understood to mean, "why information is missing", and the nulFlavors OTH, NINF, PINF, and TRC should not be used.

binding.name: NullFlavor
binding.description: A collection of codes specifying why a valid value is not present

resource.name: Html style value
resource.description: Identifies how the specified element should be rendered when displayed.

element.formal: Identifies how the specified element should be rendered when displayed.
element.comments: This extension would be equivalent to setting the HTML "style" attribute on the root element for the element containing the extension.

resource.name: Comment about the use of this code in this context
resource.description: A comment that explains how this code is used in this context (where the value set is expected to be used).

element.short: Comment about the use of this code in this context
element.formal: A comment that explains how this code is used in this context (where the value set is expected to be used).
element.comments: This is used in various FHIR value sets to make comments on how particular codes are used when the formal definition is a little abstract or vague, but it's not clear whether it belongs in the actual value set resource.

resource.name: Initial presumed answer for question
resource.description: This is the value that should be pre-populated when rendering the questionnaire for user input.

element.formal: This is the value that should be pre-populated when rendering the questionnaire for user input.

mapping.map: N/A - MIF rather than RIM level

resource.name: Email is a "direct" email
resource.display: This email is a "direct" email address
resource.description: This email address is associated with a "direct" service - e.g. http://wiki.directproject.org/Addressing+Specification.

element.formal: This email address is associated with a "direct" service - e.g. http://wiki.directproject.org/Addressing+Specification.
element.comments: This extension can only be used on contact points where the system = 'email'.

resource.name: Additional time period results
resource.publisher: HL7 International - Orders and Observations WG
resource.description: This extension is used when there are multiple result values for a single Observation Resource.  The first result for this observation is the value[x] element and any additional period results for this observation will go here.

element.formal: This extension is used when there are multiple result values for a single Observation Resource.  The first result for this observation is the value[x] element and any additional period results for this observation will go here.
element.comments: Having a single value for each Observation Resource is preferred.

resource.name: Additional attachment results
resource.publisher: HL7 International - Orders and Observations WG
resource.description: This extension is used when there are multiple result values for a single Observation Resource.  The first result for this observation is the value[x] element and any additional attachment (numeric) results for this observation will go here.

element.formal: This extension is used when there are multiple result values for a single Observation Resource.  The first result for this observation is the value[x] element and any additional attachment (numeric) results for this observation will go here.
element.comments: Having a single value for each Observation Resource is preferred.

resource.name: Where to find code system
resource.description: The formal URI for the code system.  I.e. ValueSet.define.system (or its equivalent).

element.formal: The formal URI for the code system.  I.e. ValueSet.define.system (or its equivalent).

resource.name: Appearance order for user selection
resource.description: Identifies the relative order in which concepts within the value set should be presented to a user.

element.formal: Identifies the relative order in which concepts within the value set should be presented to a user.

resource.name: buildingNumberSuffix
resource.description: Any alphabetic character, fraction or other text that may appear after the numeric portion of a building number.

element.formal: Any alphabetic character, fraction or other text that may appear after the numeric portion of a building number.

resource.name: CDA In Fulfillment of
resource.description: Standard Profile for CDA R2 on FHIR

element.short: Indicates an order that this document is created to fulfill

resource.name: Policy or plan th eactivity was defined by
resource.publisher: Health Level Seven, Inc. - EHR WG
resource.description: Policy or plan the event was defined by. Typically, a single event may have multiple applicable policy documents, such as patient consent, guarantor funding, etc.

element.short: Policy or plan th eactivity was defined by
element.formal: Policy or plan the event was defined by. Typically, a single event may have multiple applicable policy documents, such as patient consent, guarantor funding, etc.

resource.name: When the value set version becomes Active and is available for use
resource.description: This is the first date-time when the value set version becomes active, so this value is present on Inactive value set versions as well. The start Date_time is expected to be as of 0001 UTC of the Effective Date.

element.short: When the value set version becomes Active and is available for use
element.formal: This is the first date-time when the value set version becomes active, so this value is present on Inactive value set versions as well. The start Date_time is expected to be as of 0001 UTC of the Effective Date.

resource.name: unknown | asked | temp | notasked | masked | unsupported | astext | error
resource.description: Provides a reason why the expected value or elements in the element that is extended are missing.

element.short: unknown | asked | temp | notasked | masked | unsupported | astext | error
element.formal: Provides a reason why the expected value or elements in the element that is extended are missing.

binding.name: DataAbsentReason
binding.description: Used to specify why the normally expected content of the data element is missing

resource.name: Additional Institutions
resource.description: XDS allows multiple institutions for an author, but the Practitioner only allows one. If there a multiple institutions in an XDS record, use this extension for the additional ones.

element.formal: XDS allows multiple institutions for an author, but the Practitioner only allows one. If there a multiple institutions in an XDS record, use this extension for the additional ones.

resource.name: What has happened over time
resource.description: Information on changes made to the Value Set Definition over time, and also has a contained audit trail of all such changes.

element.formal: Information on changes made to the Value Set Definition over time, and also has a contained audit trail of all such changes.

element.short: The name of this set of history entries
element.formal: Label for a set of entries, such as a version.
element.comments: Typically, a value set will have a set of history entries for each major publication milestone.

element.short: Audit of all changes for a history entry
element.formal: A list of specific changes, who made them and when.
Date the change took place.

element.short: Version marker after the change was made
element.formal: Unique id for the specific change.
Person or device responsible for the change.
Description of exactly what was changed and how.

resource.name: deliveryModeIdentifier
resource.description: Represents the routing information such as a letter carrier route number. It is the identifying number of the designator (the box number or rural route number).

element.formal: Represents the routing information such as a letter carrier route number. It is the identifying number of the designator (the box number or rural route number).

resource.name: A definition for this code
resource.description: A display name that describes the meaning of this code when used as part of this value set.

element.formal: A display name that describes the meaning of this code when used as part of this value set.
element.comments: This is provided for when the source code system doesn't actually provide a definition (there are many such). Providing an definition for a code should not be done where the underlying code system provides a definition.

resource.name: Descriptors and key terms for search
resource.description: Word or words used in an information retrieval system to indicate the content of the value set.

element.short: Descriptors and key terms for search
element.formal: Word or words used in an information retrieval system to indicate the content of the value set.

resource.name: LS | AC | NB | PR | HON | BR | AD | SP | MID | CL | IN
resource.description: A set of codes each of which specifies a certain subcategory of the name part in addition to the main name part type.

element.short: LS | AC | NB | PR | HON | BR | AD | SP | MID | CL | IN
element.formal: A set of codes each of which specifies a certain subcategory of the name part in addition to the main name part type.
element.comments: Used to indicate additional information about the name part and how it should be used.

binding.name: EntityNamePartQualifier
binding.description: A set of codes each of which specifies a certain subcategory of the name part in addition to the main name part type

resource.name: Permitted values
resource.description: Allows expressing the value set that must be stored internally by the system (as distinct from the base value set which defines values for exchange).

element.formal: Allows expressing the value set that must be stored internally by the system (as distinct from the base value set which defines values for exchange).

resource.name: Max size in MB
resource.description: For attachment answers, indicates the maximum size an attachment provided in response to a question can be.

element.formal: For attachment answers, indicates the maximum size an attachment provided in response to a question can be.
element.comments: This extension only has meaning if the question.type = Attachment.

resource.name: houseNumberNumeric
resource.description: The numeric portion of a building number.

element.formal: The numeric portion of a building number.

resource.name: SHALL | SHOULD | MAY |SHOULD NOT
resource.publisher: Health Level Seven, Inc. - [WG Name] WG
resource.description: Defines the level of expectation associated with a given system capability.

element.formal: Defines the level of expectation associated with a given system capability.
element.comments:
If "SHALL NOT" is desired, use the "prohibited" modifier extension.

This extension should only be used with conformance profiles documenting requirements, not those documenting actual system capabilities.

binding.name: ConformanceExpectation
binding.description: Indicates the degree of adherence to a specified behavior or capability expected in order for a system to be deemed conformant with a specification

resource.name: Regular expression pattern
resource.description: A regular expression that defines the syntax for the data element to be considered valid.

element.formal: A regular expression that defines the syntax for the data element to be considered valid.

resource.name: county
resource.description: A sub-unit of a state or province. (49 of the United States of America use the term "county;" Louisiana uses the term "parish".).

element.formal: A sub-unit of a state or province. (49 of the United States of America use the term "county;" Louisiana uses the term "parish".).

resource.name: Specimen Rejection Reason
resource.publisher: HL7 International - Orders and Observations WG
resource.description: This extension describes the reason if a test is cancelled for specimen related reason.

element.formal: This extension describes the reason if a test is cancelled for specimen related reason.

binding.name: USLabSpecimenRejection
binding.description: Specimen Rejection Reasons codes for identifying why a test was not performed.

resource.name: Name of county
resource.description: Name of county.

element.formal: Name of county.

resource.name: Mapping from permitted to transmitted
resource.description: Expresses the linkage between the internal codes used for storage and the codes used for exchange.

element.formal: Expresses the linkage between the internal codes used for storage and the codes used for exchange.

resource.name: OID assigned to the value set or code system
resource.description: The OID assigned to the value set or code system by the author.

element.short: OID assigned to the value set or code system
element.formal: The OID assigned to the value set or code system by the author.

resource.name: Extra text to display for question
resource.publisher: U.S. Office of the National Coordinator (ONC)'s Standards and Infrastructure (S&I) Structured Data Capture project
resource.description: Additional text to display for the question along with guidance as to what sort of text it is.

element.short: Extra text to display for question
element.formal: Additional text to display for the question along with guidance as to what sort of text it is.
The additional text to display.
Categorizes the type of additional group text.  E.g. "Tool tip", "Help", "Trailing text", "Units" etc.
element.comments: The type of text may provide guidance for how/when to display the information.

binding.name: QuestionnaireQuestionTextType
binding.description: Categorizes the type of additional group text.  E.g. "Tool tip", "Help", "Trailing text", "Units" etc.

resource.name: careOf
resource.description: The name of the party who will take receipt at the specified address, and will take on responsibility for ensuring delivery to the target recipient.

element.formal: The name of the party who will take receipt at the specified address, and will take on responsibility for ensuring delivery to the target recipient.

resource.name: When the value set version should no longer be used
resource.description: The date when the value set version is no longer expected to be used to create new content. This is the first date-time when the value set version becomes Inactive, so this value MUST present on all Inactive value set versions. The start Date_time is expected to be as of 0001 UTC of the Expiration Date.

element.short: When the value set version should no longer be used
element.formal: The date when the value set version is no longer expected to be used to create new content. This is the first date-time when the value set version becomes Inactive, so this value MUST present on all Inactive value set versions. The start Date_time is expected to be as of 0001 UTC of the Expiration Date.
element.comments: Upon reaching the Expiration Date, the value set Activity Status should be consdiered as inactive. An Inactive value set version may no longer be used to create new content, but it may be used to evaluate content created prior to the Expiration Date.

resource.name: Where did this content come from
resource.description: This text is intended to act as a citation to work done elsewhere that is not part of the current stewarding process where the referenced source is in some way a basis of the current value set definition.

element.short: Where did this content come from
element.formal: This text is intended to act as a citation to work done elsewhere that is not part of the current stewarding process where the referenced source is in some way a basis of the current value set definition.
element.comments: This is not intended to be a direct link to another value set. It is only intended to support a link or textual description that indicates related material for the value set.

resource.name: translation
resource.description: An expression of the original string in an alternate language.

element.formal: An expression of the original string in an alternate language.
element.comments: string-translation elements should not have string-translation extensions (i.e. all translations should be expressed as siblings, not as a translation hierarchy) to simplify processing.

resource.name: A category of humans sharing history, origin or nationality
resource.description: A code classifying the person into a named category of humans sharing common history, traits, geographical origin or nationality.

element.short: A category of humans sharing history, origin or nationality
element.formal: A code classifying the person into a named category of humans sharing common history, traits, geographical origin or nationality.

binding.name: Race
binding.description: A code classifying the person into a named category of humans sharing common history, traits, geographical origin or nationality.

resource.name: Object Class Property
resource.description: A quality common to all members of an object class. A property may be any feature that humans naturally use to distinguish one individual object from another. It is the human perception of a single quality of an object class in the real world.  It is conceptual and thus has no particular associated means of representation by which the property can be communicated.

element.formal: A quality common to all members of an object class. A property may be any feature that humans naturally use to distinguish one individual object from another. It is the human perception of a single quality of an object class in the real world.  It is conceptual and thus has no particular associated means of representation by which the property can be communicated.
element.comments: ObjectClass and Property are treated as a data model that can be mapped to like any other.  This extension merely captures the Property element as a discrete code.  The information conveyed here should also be conveyed in human-readable form in the mapping.map element.

binding.name: 11179ObjectClassProperty
binding.description: A quality common to all members of an object class. A property may be any feature that humans naturally use to distinguish one individual object from another. It is the human perception of a single quality of an object class in the real world.  E.g. name, identifier, gender, creationDate

resource.name: Can suppress from display to user
resource.publisher: U.S. Office of the National Coordinator (ONC)'s Standards and Infrastructure (S&I) Structured Data Capture project
resource.description: If set to true, it means that the system displaying the form (or the individual encoding the form for data capture) can choose to omit the question from display to the user.

element.short: Can suppress from display to user
element.formal: If set to true, it means that the system displaying the form (or the individual encoding the form for data capture) can choose to omit the question from display to the user.
element.comments: If a group or question that contains other groups or questions is marked as "optional", all of its contents are automatically also treated as optional.

resource.name: Target for Goal
resource.publisher: Health Level Seven, Inc. - FHIR WG
resource.description: Target for Goal.

element.formal: Target for Goal.
The parameter whose value is being tracked.  E.g., body weight, blood pressure, hemoglobin A1c level.

element.short: Target value of the clinical attribute
element.formal: The target value range of the focus to be achieved to signify the fulfillment of the goal, e.g., 150 pounds, 7.0%. Either the high or low or both values of the range can be specified. When a low value is missing, it indicates that the goal is achieved at any focus value at or below the high value. Similarly, if the high value is missing, it indicates that the goal is achieved at any focus value at or above the low value.

resource.name: streetNameBase
resource.description: The base name of a roadway or artery recognized by a municipality (excluding street type and direction).

element.formal: The base name of a roadway or artery recognized by a municipality (excluding street type and direction).

resource.name: LDL is Calculated
resource.description: True if the LDL value is calculated from Chol, Trig, and HDLC.

element.formal: True if the LDL value is calculated from Chol, Trig, and HDLC.
element.comments: It's definitely better that whether the LDL was calculated or not comes from the LOINC code. But this is defined to exercise the extension machinery in the publication tooling, and to make this comment. Actually, the location is odd too - it would probably be on the root observation, but this is for testing purposes.

resource.name: Codes that this concept subsumes that have already been declared elsewhere
resource.description: Refers to another code defined within the code system that is also subsumed by this code. I.e. This concept subsumes the referenced concept.  Because meaning is inferred from hierarchy as well as definition, the presence of this extension modifies the meaning of the extended concept.

element.short: Codes that this concept subsumes that have already been declared elsewhere
element.formal: Refers to another code defined within the code system that is also subsumed by this code. I.e. This concept subsumes the referenced concept.  Because meaning is inferred from hierarchy as well as definition, the presence of this extension modifies the meaning of the extended concept.

resource.name: Where the activity occurred, if relevant

resource.description: The phyiscal location of the event (e.g. Building, room, etc.).

element.short: Where the activity occurred, if relevant
element.formal: The phyiscal location of the event (e.g. Building, room, etc.).

resource.name: E.g. "(a)", "1.", etc.
resource.description: The label to list in front of a code when presenting a list of possible values in a questionnaire-like fashion.

element.formal: The label to list in front of a code when presenting a list of possible values in a questionnaire-like fashion.

resource.name: Additional quantitative results
resource.publisher: HL7 International - Orders and Observations WG
resource.description: This extension is used when there are multiple result values for a single Observation Resource.  The first result for this observation is the value[x] element and any additional quantitative (numeric) results for this observation will go here.

element.formal: This extension is used when there are multiple result values for a single Observation Resource.  The first result for this observation is the value[x] element and any additional quantitative (numeric) results for this observation will go here.
element.comments: Having a single value for each Observation Resource is preferred.

resource.name: deliveryInstallationArea
resource.description: The location of the delivery installation, usually a town or city, and is only required if the area is different from the municipality. Area to which mail delivery service is provided from any postal facility or service such as an individual letter carrier, rural route, or postal route.

element.formal: The location of the delivery installation, usually a town or city, and is only required if the area is different from the municipality. Area to which mail delivery service is provided from any postal facility or service such as an individual letter carrier, rural route, or postal route.

resource.name: Reason activity is occurring

element.formal: The reason that the activity was taking place.

binding.name: EventPurposeOfUse
binding.description: Indicates the why the event occurred

resource.name: Patient's professed religious affiliation
resource.description: A code classifying a person's professed religion.

element.formal: A code classifying a person's professed religion.

binding.name: Religion
binding.description: A code classifying a person's professed religion
